item.title: Chocolate Chip "Wonderbread"
item.description: Prepare Batter: In a stand mixer, combine the egg white powder and water. Beat until stiff peaks form. Combine Ingredients: Gently fold in the Greek yogurt, being careful not to overmix. Add the chocolate chips and fold until just combined. Bake: Transfer the batter into an oiled baking tin. Bake in a preheated oven at 180Â°C (350Â°F) for about 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Cool and Serve: Allow to cool slightly.

item.title: Galician-style eggs
item.description: For 2 servings. Prepare the cold water: Before starting the recipe, fill a bowl with lukewarm water (from the tap) and place it in the fridge, preferably in the coldest part. If you have ice at home, you can skip this step. Boil the eggs: Bring a pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the eggs, salt to taste, and a dash of vinegar (optional) to help peel the eggs more easily later.

item.title: Mushrooms in sauce with egg
item.description: Ingredients for 2 servings. Peel and chop the garlic cloves and sautÃ© them in a pot with a drizzle of oil. Peel and chop the onion, add it to the pot, and let it soften. Season and add the dried chili peppers. Add the flour and cook it. Pour in the wine and add the cleaned and quartered mushrooms. Season and cook for 12-15 minutes. Remove the chili peppers and fill 2 oven-proof ramekins with the mushroom mixture.
